description:
This class introduces students to the study of international political economy.
Students will examine the structure of the global political economy, the drivers
and implications of globalization, and the role of international economic
institutions in driving political and economic outcomes. Among others, this
class will cover topics such as international financial institutions, trade, financial crises, foreign aid, economic development, energy politics, and illicit
trade.
title: International Political Economy
prerequisite: YCC1121 Comparative Social Inquiry or with the permission of the instructor.
